website_summaries.verdict: This portable pop-up green screen comes with a collapsible stand and offers blue screen option on the flip side.
pros: Highly portable, making it easy to set up and use wherever you need it
Stand collapses down to 2 feet and extends to 7 feet
The durable spring metal screen folds down to a 30-by-30-inch disc and slips into carrying case
cons: Users report that screen is difficult to fold back down

customer_reviews.title: Works great for video conference meetings
customer_reviews.text: Works great with my Logitech 922 webcam using the Zoom videoconference platform. The greenscreen effect is flawless. I can set this screen up in seconds at home and do videoconferences with a virtual office background. So much easier than keeping a room, and more importantly all of the stuff in the background, clear and clutter free for video conferences. Highly recommend this for anyone who teaches online or does lots of business video meetings (Zoom, Skype, Webex, etc.).
customer_reviews.author: Edward BarnettTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Nice blue / green screen for video effects
customer_reviews.text: I really like the concept of this, but it does take some time to "learn" how to properly fold it when finished. It does have a blue side and green side to make video effects easier and seamless, however, it seems to be a bit smaller than needed width wise. Also, it can take some practice getting the screen clipped into the holder. This is best for stationary locations as it's a bit difficult to maneuver and tote around. Overall, not bad for a green/blue screen, but it could use some improvements. The price is reasonable.
customer_reviews.author: Wil R.

customer_reviews.title: Made of muslin and wrinkles
customer_reviews.text: This arrived and I opened it today. Larger than expected, and I did not expect it to be muslin and full of wrinkles. The white side doesn’t look 100% white, little bit gray as the black shows through, and don’t forget that even the white side is piped with black edging. Looking around for something better so I can send this back.
customer_reviews.author: CharlieM6

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the purchase price.
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Easy to open and setup, but takes a little practice to wrangle back into the carry case. The spring loaded grip design at the top of the tripod could be slightly larger to improve the ease of installation. It takes a bit of work to keep it open enough to cling to the frame. It is not completely wrinkle free, but enough that it is workable as a backdrop. Bought one for myself and another for a friend.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Brubaker

customer_reviews.title: Not what I was hoping for
customer_reviews.text: Its green and works, but its also very bad quality. The screen is help by a clamp that rips the material around the edges. Its not easy to fold, and also seems to hurt the edges everytime I fold it because there is metal in the trim and it pokes through the material. The stand is fine and it does its job, but its pretty bad quality and doesnt stand the test of time (I'm talking 2 months its got tears in the black trim. I wish I had spent a bit more money and gotten the retractable green screen from elgato.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Fills the Bill Well
customer_reviews.text: Good fabric. Stand is better than I expected; sturdy and yet easy to move around. I have had this on its stand since I received it and have moved it a number of times by simply picking up the stand with the screen on it. One quibble is that the screen holding clip at the top of the stand doesn't seem to easily open far enough to easily remove the screen. So if you're going to need to take in down often, this might be a bit frustrating. I haven't needed to. Because of that, I haven't folded it either so I cannot comment on how easily that might be done. I would buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: H. Roberson

customer_reviews.title: The perfect solution for my virtual job interview
customer_reviews.text: This worked perfectly for me. I was happily surprised that the screen is made of a cloth fabric instead of plastic/nylon. There are minor wrinkles but since its made out of cloth, the wrinkles do not show up on the camera. I may have only needed it for a day but it was money well spent. I used the blue side and it looked very impressive. With Zoom video conference, the software is able to recognize the blue side as a "green" screen so no need to move it around to change your background. It was tricky folding up, but after watching the how-to video, its a breeze. Just fold it like a taco!
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I needed a green screen to use for virtual backgrounds while video conferencing. This is perfect, it makes my set-up more professional and allows me to use a virtual background without getting the "halo" effect around my curly hair. This is a must for anyone who is doing business virtually and using video to do so.
customer_reviews.author: Lois Leftwich

customer_reviews.title: OK If You Never Fold It
customer_reviews.text: I have had several name brand backgrounds of this sort which I quite liked. Having a need for a black/white, I thought Id try this budget one out. Construction is good, folds well. The problem: Cloth-like material instead of the synthetic/plastic-like material on the name brand ones. The issue: Wrinkles. Terrible wrinkles when open that don't go away. Stored open in semi humid conditions and the wrinkles are still there. Can probably steam them out but I'm not carrying a steamer and water into the field.
customer_reviews.author: MitchWTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Nice Green Screen for Video Conferencing!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this green screen for use with Zoom as my laptop requires a green screen to use virtual backgrounds. Getting the screen frame into the clip at the top of the tripod is a little awkward, as is folding the screen to put back in the bag - it just takes a little bit of practice. The screen is green/blue muslin, and the frame is substantial. There is a nice zippered storage bag and the tripod is of good quality. I would recommend to a friend seeking a portable green screen!
customer_reviews.author: Nora H.

customer_reviews.title: Very well made
customer_reviews.text: Product is as described and very well made. I would like one that is a little smaller to use for behind my desk for zoom meetings. I am 5-2 and this is 7 feet tall, so a little difficult for me to maneuver on my own. There is a tab at the top so your can hook the tripod. Would be nice if there was also one in the middle going horizontal. Other than that it really is a nicely make screen and I use all the time
customer_reviews.author: Baconbitz

customer_reviews.title: Great for Virtual Meetings
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect size for virtual meetings. Still trying to figure out how to fold it back up again but it's definitely worth the price. Very durable and there's some weight to it. The stand is sturdy and reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Kristy

customer_reviews.title: Use for training online
customer_reviews.text: Since I work at home and train people using online technology, this green screen does a great job for the chrome effect in Zoom and Camtasia. Setting up is pretty easy but folding to put away is challenging. Comes with a great storage bag and a nice stand for sturdy use. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Eric P. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: So so
customer_reviews.text: It’s green. And it’s a screen. So it’s hot that going for it. The frame is ok. Could use a second anchor point so it hangs straight. The material is super thin. Can’t use it in front of any light or it leaks thru.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick F

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic quality for the money spent--great value.
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent green and blue background which works well as a professional online meeting background. I very pleased with the tripod as well. I just lean it up against a chair. At first, I did not realize how to fold it properly. Once I learned it is quick and easy to get out and put away.
customer_reviews.author: M. Weaver

customer_reviews.title: Sent it back
customer_reviews.text: It came warped out of the package and was too big and tall for me to set it up so it would stop moving around on its pole. As a result, when I tried to use it as a green screen, it wavered in and out and my image appeared surrounded and obscured by black clouds. I sent it back.
customer_reviews.author: SWA

customer_reviews.title: I like the screen, but the stand...the cip will not hold the screen!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I can find nowhere on the sellers page to let them know I need to only replace the stand, not the greenscreen. I have driven myself nuts trying to get it in the clip. It just won't fit, no matter what I do. I don't know how to ask them to replace the stand and not the greenscreen. I am soooo frustrated. I don't know what to do. It just won't fit in that hole provided.
customer_reviews.author: Suzie Vigon

customer_reviews.title: Nice screen
customer_reviews.text: Seems good. Only unfolded it a few times. Was a little wrinkled when I first unfolded it, but those pulled out within 30 mins. Worked good on a few test shots I took. Lighting is key to get a good photo to remove background. Have not tried it with video yet, but I'm sure it will work great.
customer_reviews.author: Amos

customer_reviews.title: Its the perfect background for virtual screens on ZOOM
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set and take down. Viewers really thought the background was in my shop when it was only a picture of my shop!
customer_reviews.author: J R.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Portable Green Screen for Streaming
customer_reviews.text: My space is small and you can see my kitchen behind me, so I wanted a green screen for streaming video games. This doesn't disappoint. It's quite large, and you can chroma key between the green side and blue side. It is a pain to put away. I recommend the YouTube video linked on Amazon for help. It's simple once you've done it a few times. This is an incredible investment.
customer_reviews.author: Red

customer_reviews.title: Nice Screen! Not Easy to Fold!
customer_reviews.text: The size is pretty true to the dimensions listed on the product description. We bought a stand from another seller which compliments the screen nicely. It comes with a travel case which is great. The issue is folding it back into a circle to fit into the case. We have had to revisit Youtube videos on doing so, as it is not easy. We still recommend to others.
customer_reviews.author: Tervon Walton

customer_reviews.title: White seems thin and arrived with marks
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to open but to my surprise the white side has blue marks on it. See attached photo. The white side has marks and plenty of wrinkles. I'm sure that a little steam will take care of those. Now the blue marks, yet to be determined. The black side shows no wrinkles or marks and will make a nice backdrop. The background frame seems to be sturdy and doesn't bow like others I've seen.
customer_reviews.author: DUB T

customer_reviews.title: I love this Blue Green screen combo!
customer_reviews.text: The blue//green screen combo is awesome and I recommend it. I purchased it for a kid that is doing photo work and haven't seen much of him since he got the green screen. He loves it too! The fact that it folds up is great - just remember if you take it down you may need to iron it again. The only reason it gets a four is the stand could be made a bit more steady, however with a little finagling we could get it to stand steady.
customer_reviews.author: Useless CauseTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Good over all, but not for twitch steamers.
customer_reviews.text: Im using this green screen for twitch streaming. First of all, if you are a short person like me you will have a very hard time setting it up. It has some wrinkles here and there but it doesn't show up when streaming. I would recommend the elgato green screen over this one if you are a gamer like me. Other than that, it does the job its supposed to do. You should probable get this green screen if you are a vlogger, model, etc...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for Zoom
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product, use it almost daily for Zoom calls. Folding might be a challenge for some, but if you’ve ever had those sun shades for your car, similar oval shaped folding device; if you have the wingspan to get it started folding in half, it sort of does the rest on its own. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Quadra7hundred

customer_reviews.title: Huge
customer_reviews.text: This thing is huge! It is challenging for one person to fold. I just leave it out. It looks off white but photographs white with good lighting. It does have a few wrinkles along the edge but no problem for me.
customer_reviews.author: Nellie

customer_reviews.title: Portability: Easy to adapt for setup in tight spaces.
customer_reviews.text: the instructional video that shows the setup & take down was spot on. If you have arthritic fingers (I do) then a second person might be needed to "activate" the clipping mechanism that interfaces the stand to the screen. As the video points out...you will need to practice the technique to collapses the screen back into a circle. Definitely two thumbs up!!
customer_reviews.author: CFT

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this purchase. Was worried I would have to steam the material to get the wrinkles out however to my suprise there were very few after unpacking.
customer_reviews.author: The Kid From Buffalo

customer_reviews.title: faulty clasp
customer_reviews.text: The plastic clasp holding the screen is extremely difficulty to use. It's made of cheap plastic. It is very difficult to insert the screen frame inside the clasp. I dread setting up the screen each time I need to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Langton

customer_reviews.title: Love this! It is a "must have" on every ...
customer_reviews.text: Love this! It is a "must have" on every photo shoot. I don't necessarily use it every time, but I use it often enough I always bring it. It is a perfect little shade maker for when you can't help shooting in full open sun, or for when you are shooting where there is dappled lighting like under a tree. The downside, it is huge and unwieldy especially in wind, so make sure you have two people to hold it.
customer_reviews.author: Angela Anderson

customer_reviews.title: It works really well
customer_reviews.text: So i didnt bother looking at the size when i bought it. Its a lot bigger than i thought, lol but it works well! I got it for my little brother for his bday. Its not so easy to put back but he just keeps it out all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Ariel

customer_reviews.title: Good, but slightly confusing to fold back up the first few times.
customer_reviews.text: This works great but folding it up can be a bit confusing. I tried for longer than I want to admit the first 5 or so times to get this folded. This caused a bit of warping, but that's on me not the product itself.
customer_reviews.author: Lucas Schwieder

customer_reviews.title: Underwhelmed
customer_reviews.text: A bit overpriced relatively speaking. The Cowboy Studio brand is much sturdier and better made in my opinion. This will absolutely get the job done however it is not near the same build quality as the Cowboy Studio which is about 10 bucks less. I hate giving bad reviews but Fotodiox if you're listening you need to step it up a bit or lower the price and make this an entry level device. If it were in the 33.00 range I would have no issue with it as that would be a fair price. Sufficient but entry level. However at 56.00 it is disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Just Another Geek

customer_reviews.title: So far so great. Pops open and just a few very minor ...
customer_reviews.text: So far so great. Pops open and just a few very minor wrinkles go away in an hour or two at room temperature. I use it as a backdrop behind two anchors for web news in a small space. I've only tried a couple of images as of now and they work very well with the four lighting route. Two lights to the sides and slightly behind the talent illuminating the screen. A backlight or hair-light and one soft head-on light. I'm pleased with the results in this small area. And the price can't be beat for this particular quality.
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: I do love this kit quite well and have used this on a video shoot, and 3 photo shoots. The white is dull until lit, which is nice and produces near to no shadow. The black is also absorbent to light which makes it very usable for many applications. I do have the Chromakey Blue/Green set as well and yes these have wrinkles as it's folded into a 27" circle from 5'x7'! I used some wrinkle release and it worked well. I do worry about the white if it does get dirty. Cleaning this thing might be difficult. So far so good and it's not bad on weight.
customer_reviews.author: Gary 0765Top Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Very good/usable...
customer_reviews.text: Works good. Size is big...... I like that the material is none reflective, but it also is a dust/lint magnet.(nothing a little tape or lint brush/roller can't fix) I wish that it had loops on the long side. My fix is two alligator clips and a small bungee cord. I've watched numerous videos on how to fold these things and I feel like it's my first time every-time I fold it back up. I have never done it on the first attempt... it is very funny that I haven't "learned" the technique after using this thing for so long.
customer_reviews.author: Rodo Photo

customer_reviews.title: Nice green screen..
customer_reviews.text: After spending an hour watching various YouTube videos on how to fold it back up to place back into it's pouch (that it comes with), I have to say I'm glad I bought this item. It seems to be made well and is of good quality fabric. The only gripe I have is that it TOOK FOREVER to arrive. We're talking months. That's kinda ridiculous, Fotodiox. C'mon now..
customer_reviews.author: R. Stark

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to store.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very durable, well-built green screen. The problem is that it is very difficult to fold and store. I got this originally for my classroom, but struggled so many times to collapse it that I snapped the frame. (I know there is a trick to folding something like this, but even after multiple videos, I still struggled.) It's also very narrow when vertical, so it limits your frame size. If you can leave it up somewhere, it's a great tool.
customer_reviews.author: SFnative78

customer_reviews.title: It was great at first the first 2 sessions went well I ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this a few weeks ago and finally had a chance to take it out and use it on some sessions this past weekend. It was great at first the first 2 sessions went well I collapsed it put it away and on the last session when I pulled it out the metal inside snapped and cut my hand open I was so upset spent $60 on something that lasted 2 sessions :(
customer_reviews.author: Samson

customer_reviews.title: I use primarily the black side when doing Google Hangouts because they provide a nice contrast and are free of distractions
customer_reviews.text: High quality and the colors are solid. The frames are "springy" so you can fold them back up into a circle when storing or transporting them. I use primarily the black side when doing Google Hangouts because they provide a nice contrast and are free of distractions. I recommend these to everyone when I am doing video production training in my classes. I also bought the Fotodiox 5 x 7 collapsible 2-in-1 background Panel Chromakey Green and Blue kit as well.
customer_reviews.author: Miles Austin

customer_reviews.title: Great green screen
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size for single person green screen and VERY easy to collapse and store when not needed (there are videos on how to collapse this if you're having trouble). My only issue is that after keeping it stored for a while, part of the band seems to have maybe warped a little bit. Now whenever I hang it up, it is always at an angle. It still works fine for my uses, but definitely be careful if you're using it for more sensitive shoots.
customer_reviews.author: Judgement0s

customer_reviews.title: Works Perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: The stand is perfect and you can orient the screen in any direction easily. It comes with a storage bag that makes the screen a small thin circle. The hardest thing about using this product was learning to put it back in it's storage bag. Watch a youtube video or two and it becomes very easy to store. I do use it so much I have decided to leave it up for now. It has both green and blue chroma and is just large enough for streaming on Twitch.
customer_reviews.author: Jack/Amelia Smith

customer_reviews.title: Makes it easy!
customer_reviews.text: I researched extensively before purchasing this. This is perfect! The memory steel frame pulls tight enough to remove nearly all of the wrinkles from the fabric. I don't have a lot of space to leave a chromakey screen set-up all the time. I can pull this out of it's case and have it set up in a minute... without wrinkles. Taking it down is just as easy. And if you have difficulty folding it, look it up on YouTube and you'll have it back in its' case in no time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Did not work for what I needed. My 11 year old was making music videos at home and HAD to have a green screen. This was a good one but too large for the space that she needed. We struggled to put it away which is why just okay. Not a product issue but a consumer issue of not being able to figure it out so that there was no frustration. It was an easy return. Soon after video making stopped so glad that the search ended there!
customer_reviews.author: Marie

customer_reviews.title: Large enough for two subjects to be photographed
customer_reviews.text: It is large as per the size. I bought a stand for it also. Took a few photos of the 20ish old son and his girl friend them photoshopped them into various placed around the globe. Makes a great green screen effect. Remember to brightly light the subjects and have them stand well infront of the screen to prevent shadows as green screen shadows spoil the effect.
customer_reviews.author: Bee Cool Travel

customer_reviews.title: Great for my Zoom meetings
customer_reviews.text: I've been working from home for a month so far. My days are spent in Zoom meetings. I love having this large green screen. I can block out my house and look more professional. It's also fun to put in whimsical backgrounds.
customer_reviews.author: Kerrin M. McMahan

customer_reviews.title: Nice background screen and a good size
customer_reviews.text: Nice background screen and a good size. I've used both colors for chromakeying and it's worked great. The material seems durable as long as you don't abuse it, and it stretches out the wrinkles fairly well. Folding, as others have mentioned, can be troubling. I found it's much easier with two people, especially once you remember the how to do it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael M.Top Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: I like this background (and also the blue/green version) and feel ...
customer_reviews.text: I like this background (and also the blue/green version) and feel it works fine for the money. Folding can be a chore and is much easier with 2 people, you just need to remember how to do it each time. Once folded it does store well in it's bag. I don't have any seems showing in mine and the white is consistently bright (should be lit well anyway).
customer_reviews.author: Michael M.Top Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Works well, it's shorter than 5x7 though.
customer_reviews.text: Works very well as a quick to set up backdrop and a portable backdrop as well. It's slightly under 5x7 and honestly, even a small model's arms outstretch 5 feet. A far better size would be 6x8, I know it's only another foot but it would make a huge difference. It's difficult to shoot a 6 foot model with a little less than a foot clearance if you want to shoot upward. As I was shooting for the first time with it, I kept noticing, if it was only about a foot wider and a foot higher it would better cover the model.
customer_reviews.author: AC Wild

customer_reviews.title: Eh. Glad I purchased it but small issues
customer_reviews.text: It serves its purpose but came with the frame slightly bent. It's also wrinkled so I'll need to steam it. The blue/green, I purchased was perfect in every way so I use it a bit more.
customer_reviews.author: Banza Townsend Tracey

customer_reviews.title: it's nice to have a portable backdrop like this
customer_reviews.text: Handy to have but very challenging to fold back down all by yourself. Definitely a 2-person job to collapse it back down to the portable size. That being said, it's nice to have a portable backdrop like this. The white side isn't super-white do often it photographs in a shade of gray, but the black side is nice and opaque. Not good for outdoor use really because it is fabric and it could pick up dirt and stains, and light shows through unless you're working in a shaded area.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie Ramiro

customer_reviews.title: good and great price
customer_reviews.text: good and great price. and I had a really hard time to fold it back ( I spent 10mints trying to fold it back). after i search a video to how to fold it back.  now it good to go.
customer_reviews.author: zhuomeiwu

customer_reviews.title: A must-have for location shots.
customer_reviews.text: I wish this came in a larger size. Even when position wide, talent sometimes move their arms out of the background.But it still gets the job done and keys great. My only complaint is that the cloth that holds the steel flex is too thin. After a couple of uses it's already wearing through in a few places. We have patched it with gaff tape to try and keep it from ripping out.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Weber

customer_reviews.title: Really impressed!
customer_reviews.text: Really good! Bigger than what I was expecting and happy it was. Not so easy to fold, it requires some workaround, but you get used to that. The clip to attach to the stand also a little bit tricky to operate. But overall not bad at all.
customer_reviews.author: Elisha Record Studio

customer_reviews.title: Gift for PC gamer
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my boyfriend. He streams on twitch and loved this gift!! It’s so nice and convenient. Doesn’t take up too much room, easy to fold up and move out of the way when he isn’t wanting to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Addicted2Amazon

customer_reviews.title: LOADED WITH WRINKLES!
customer_reviews.text: I had a green screen purchased from another company which was completely wrinkle-free. When I opened the Fotodiox background, it was completely wrinkled! I didn't have time to steam it, so I had to tape my audition against a blank wall. I will NEVER purchase ANYTHING from this company in the future!
customer_reviews.author: Ray Watters

customer_reviews.title: On arrival the stand was broken at the to where the clip is to hold the panel and well beyond repair of super glue. Instead of s
customer_reviews.text: Its not as green as the other ones available, but it is as shown. On arrival the stand was broken at the to where the clip is to hold the panel and well beyond repair of super glue. Instead of sending it back though im going to just clamp it on with spring loaded C-clamps and itll get the job done easily. Pros: Stand is almost all metal and easy to setup as well as the panel. Cons: The clip at the top is plastic (bad idea) and i wish there was a carrying/storage case for the stand.
customer_reviews.author: j wheels

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: i like that it folds down to allmost nothing i have small space to record and need to remove it fast an easy and the price weel it allmost is the same at elgatos chroma key screen and the keying is so much eseyer because it stretches by it self
customer_reviews.author: Martin braüner

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: This works GREAT! I love it. I did an outdoor shoot using sunlight to light the green screen and that worked perfectly. The green dropped out better than any other green screen I have worked with. Folding it up afterwards was a problem but that's because I forgot a step. Following instructions it folds in seconds.
customer_reviews.author: Slick

customer_reviews.title: Great background! (Black and White)
customer_reviews.text: I really like this product. Bought it as a background so that I can make videos and it really serves it’s purpose. I had a little hard time mounting it but once I read the instructions, no problem... ha! My only issue is that you can see through the background just a bit. Not too bad because I can still make videos without my audience seeing through it. Definitely worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Fotodiox Portable Backdrop
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product for the price. Setup is quick. If you purchase this make sure you practice folding it up and putting it away a few times before your first job....it can be a tussle to do. Some recommended cleaning instructions for the white side may have been helpful as well. I can see it getting dirty and smudged over time. 2013 Update: I have this quite a few times....not as much as I would like to. The fabric hasn't gotten dirty yet so no cleaning tipe. I have noticed that the shape gets a little distorted at first if it stays in the sleeve too long.
customer_reviews.author: David C

customer_reviews.title: Wrinkle-free, easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: This was easy to set up, has no wrinkles, and doesn't take up a lot of space. It works great for my home office space.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Brooks

customer_reviews.title: It is just what it says it is! A bit hard to fold up, though
customer_reviews.text: I just got this in, inspected it, and indeed it is exactly what you'd expect from the description -- a collapsable panel with black and white sides. It took me a while to figure out how to fold it up, but this video: [...] (sorry, Amazon gets picky about URLs in reviews), or video #36101689 on vimeo, shows how to do it. It's pretty easy. Basically, you start facing the long side of the panel, fold it up into a U shape, walk your hands to about the middle, and then cross your arms while holding the panel. If you look at the video it's pretty simple once you get the hang of it.
customer_reviews.author: Charles McGuinness

customer_reviews.title: Very good backdrop for on location shoots
customer_reviews.text: After tearing down my studio a few times for on location shoots, I started looking for a better way. This is a great size backdrop and unlike my other ones, always looks wrinkle-free. I was even able to collapse it down to fit in its carrying case after a couple of tries when I first got it. I found the clip that holds the backdrop rather difficult because it just doesn't seem to open wide enough to accommodate the wide flexible outer band of the backdrop. When I finally got it in, I was not confident that it would hold.
customer_reviews.author: Marlene E. Lebel

customer_reviews.title: This was a good investment.
customer_reviews.text: This is a portable background. It is large and covers a big area. It comes with a stand. I did not think it would be as big. I teach online and it cover the entire scope of the camera. This was a good investment.
customer_reviews.author: M Reid

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced for quality
customer_reviews.text: Not very good quality. The colors are great, but when I open it to use it, it will not stay flat, it always has a slight diagonal bend so I have to use something to hold it flat against the wall or it's unusable. Disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: B Man

customer_reviews.title: Tricky but easy to use
customer_reviews.text: At first I was a bit lost on how to fold this thing up, but I watch a video from You Tube and it is 'easy-peasy'. I love this back drop when I am doing on location photography. It is easy to transport, set up and fold. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Diane Irwin

customer_reviews.title: Good idea but bad design
customer_reviews.text: Because they rounded the edges it doesn’t work. I have tried but the camera picks up the rounded part so it’s very hard to get the whole thing on screen...very frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Russell

customer_reviews.title: but the blue also makes a nice background for some talking head type videos
customer_reviews.text: High quality and the colors are solid. The frames are "springy" so you can fold them back up into a circle when storing or transporting them. I use primarily the green side, but the blue also makes a nice background for some talking head type videos. I recommend these to everyone when I am doing video production training in my classes. I also bought the Fotodiox 5 x 7 collapsible 2-in-1 background Panel Black and White at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: Miles Austin

customer_reviews.title: Great product, clumsy refolding it
customer_reviews.text: Great product, I don't have the need to use these often but when I do they are awesome. Only problem is I need to watch a youtube on how to fold it every time, it can be bit clumsy refolding.
customer_reviews.author: LaNutcia

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: This is just what I needed for my video work! Fast delivery, too!
customer_reviews.author: John L.

customer_reviews.title: The screen works well, does need to be ironed out when you receive it
customer_reviews.text: The screen works well, does need to be ironed out when you receive it, however the only issue I have is that you can only place it in portrait mode - there is no attachment to place it in landscape. I was so disappointed with that, but for the cost of other green screens, this worked really well.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Great background cover for web cams or pictures
customer_reviews.text: I needed a panel or shield that would cover my background while on webinars and mastermind groups. I did not realize how big it was until I opened the box and it basically covered everything! I can switch the background if I wish and it took some practice but it folds easily and you can store it in the zippered pouch it came in. It does have an odd smell but usually something one should expect, but the smell quickly dissipated and tucked away in my closet for next use. HIghly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: C. J. SMALLS

customer_reviews.title: Does what it's supposed to do quite well, bet gets bent.
customer_reviews.text: The green screen is quite good. There is a bit of wrinkles forming after you fold it and unfold it, but it's not that big of an issue. Only slight disappointment with it is that the frame gets quite bent after a little bit of use. It still works the way it should, but it's bent. Might be because of the method I use to fold it, but yet again, there are no instructions on how to fold it, so you use the info you find online.
customer_reviews.author: Roy R.

customer_reviews.title: absolutely love it.
customer_reviews.text: This green screen is MASSIVE. It is 5' x 7' and the stand is very customizable to the hight. It can be used vertically or horizontally. A little top heavy when on soft carpet, but holds up ok! Setup takes seconds, but takedown took me a few tries. After watching a video on youtube, the easiest way to take it down is the "taco and twist" method. 5 Stars, absolutely love it.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Lake

customer_reviews.title: everything else is great, especially having different colors on both sides
customer_reviews.text: The only criticism I would mention, is that there weren't any instructions on how to fold the background panel properly. I know people can look it up on the internet, and I did, but I feel having even a small flyer on how to collapse the panel, would be a courtesy that most customers would appreciate. Otherwise, everything else is great, especially having different colors on both sides. One would be surprised how hard those kinds of panels can be to find outside of Amazon or the company's official website. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not too difficult to fold, but this product is AWESOME for post!
customer_reviews.text: I read comments by others buyers, and bought it. It's an excellent product to do some footage to postproduction in a semipro level. This cover from feets and head to mayor person. It has double face with green and blue, and its tripod it's excellent to stand this big chromakey. I do some postproduction and this kind of products make a great difference, and save me a lot of money omitting shooting some footage that I need on a chroma key painted stage.
customer_reviews.author: Usuario Comprobado

customer_reviews.title: This portable screen is excellent for being on the go.
customer_reviews.text: This screen works; I have little to explain as to the quality other than I was completely clueless about them and through a tutorial on youtube I managed to fold it up effortlessly. Works great on webcams, camcorders and video from DSLRs.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn Dubois

customer_reviews.title: Good screen, bad stand
customer_reviews.text: 4 stars because the stand was trash for how large and heavy this screen is. You have to have it set perfectly or it will fall over. Legs need to be stronger and be able to collapse more.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Schoolcraft

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for streaming from my bedroom.
customer_reviews.text: This background is perfect for smaller rooms. I don't have space for a full drape and background lighting kit. I just set this up behind my chair, in front of the window, so that sunlight illuminates everything. It works!
customer_reviews.author: The Oldest Newb

customer_reviews.title: It does go back in the bag
customer_reviews.text: My personal preference is a hanging backdrop because it's easier to get wrinkles out of but this collapsible works for its purpose, and it's portable. This is really big though, unless you're over 6 feet tall. But if you watch one of the Youtube videos about how to collapse it, it does go back in the bag. I accomplished it and I'm way under 6 feet tall.
customer_reviews.author: Neena

customer_reviews.title: Paid for itself in the convenience
customer_reviews.text: Only used it a couple of times. Paid for itself in the convenience. Not that hard to fold up. Watch the Youtube videos and follow along. Better if you are fairly tall. This thing is quite large both folded and expanded. Seems to be decent quality build. Good fabric weight. Almost wrinkle free. I got a great key with low and not so even lighting. I expect this to be durable for years.
customer_reviews.author: R. Lager

customer_reviews.title: Mostly amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy build, but the stand awkwardly clips onto the top and hangs it in place with no bottom support, so the slightest movement sends it teetering left and right. Also came with no instructions, so I have no idea how to fold it up for storage (without damaging it) and it took me a little while to understand how to correctly hang the device. Like I said, no instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Chase M.

customer_reviews.title: Must have for me
customer_reviews.text: Great green screen. Good luck folding it back up! Large size is both goad and bad. Gives you an adequate size background but is too large for average indoor room. Use it for iPad mini green screen. Proper lighting is the key to success.
customer_reviews.author: mr wiener

customer_reviews.title: A little tricky but worth the trouble.
customer_reviews.text: The background is a little hard to collapse, the stand seems steady but the clip on top is really hard to get on he background. Seems as if the clip is to small for the screens edge.
customer_reviews.author: Oliver Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Works as promissed
customer_reviews.text: Yes, it will pop you in the face a few times while you learn to fold it but, it's not too bad once you get it down. Beware - this thing is huge even folded! Not sure if they gave the collapsed dimensions or not but, when folded up in the bag this thing is 26" in diameter! (About as big around as a car tire - not exactly going in your camera bag :) Might consider what your going to use to hold it with too. I'm using two of these: on two light stands.
customer_reviews.author: psaltidog

customer_reviews.title: if I want to use it horizontally I would have to use clips which is not easy because I'm afraid I'll break the flimsy steel edge
customer_reviews.text: The green screen works perfectly for keying. But the stand is flimsy and the top that holds it was broken when it arrived, so I had to make a stand with PCB pipes. Also, only one side - the long side - has a loop to hang the green screen when using, however, if I want to use it horizontally I would have to use clips which is not easy because I'm afraid I'll break the flimsy steel edges of the green screen.
customer_reviews.author: Kini

customer_reviews.title: I feel like it lets too much light through
customer_reviews.text: The stand is not entirely stable. You have to really finagle the stand to keep it from falling over when the screen is attached. For the screen, I feel like it lets too much light through. I also wish the screen had a hanger on the side so you could hang it sideways from the stand when you need a wider area behind you.
customer_reviews.author: izeonme

customer_reviews.title: Excellent and portable product!
customer_reviews.text: The product works well with Zoom as well as videos produced in Camtasia. I love it and especially love the fact that it does not take up an entire wall!
customer_reviews.author: Ed Becker

customer_reviews.title: I'm thinking these will be easier and better than umbrellas
customer_reviews.text: I'm thinking these will be easier and better than umbrellas, for a portable studio kit anyway. Outside maybe the umbrellas would be better. Arrived today and I set it up then stowed it back away easy as pie.
customer_reviews.author: mudobber

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for streaming!
customer_reviews.text: I love this green screen! Works perfectly for Twitch.tv streaming and anything else that you might need to key out with a chroma key. I love that it's just one stand and a green screen card and not a cloth with 2 stands-it's just more to hassle with but this thing is perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan G

customer_reviews.title: Great for beginning photographers
customer_reviews.text: This is great for us beginning photographers who are looking for affordable Chromakey screens to practice with. The size is perfect when it's opened up. It doesn't hang perfectly straight though, but that can be corrected by simply placing chairs behind the screen, mounting on a wall or using a double stand system. Takes a little practice to learn how to collapse it back down, but there are plenty of how to videos on the internet that show you the easiest ways.
customer_reviews.author: Dorothy Taylor

customer_reviews.title: The stand came broken
customer_reviews.text: The stand for this came broken and I fixed it with some gorilla glue, so all is well. The stand isn't the best, but it'll do.
customer_reviews.author: Logan

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected
customer_reviews.text: This pretty much does what you see in the pictures, is foldable to store away when you don't need it, and is priced fairly. I am still in the process of figuring out how to block light from coming in through the back of it as it is rather thin. Beware of this if you plan to have a light source behind it.
customer_reviews.author: Prolific Oaktree

customer_reviews.title: Great Green Screen Background for Streaming
customer_reviews.text: The product shipped quickly and arrived on time undamaged. Even though it is somewhat cumbersomer to fold up, this product is awesome. It does exactly what it says. I purchased the background and the stand combo. I like how I can mount the background vertically or horizontally. Once fold it up if it's the bag perfectly. There is no bag for the stand however. Overall it's a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Myhre

customer_reviews.title: Worked so well my boss thought I was in the ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked so well my boss thought I was in the same building as him. I was in a video conference with my boss and used the green screen to put myself in a local conference room to his location.He then spent an hour walking around looking for me later in the day.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Perfect green screen!
customer_reviews.text: It is the right product for my needs. Very nice quality and easy set up. I don't need to keep it in its pouch, so I don't care it requires practice to learn how to fold it. It works great with Zoom and OBS. I definitely recommend this screen. Do your research to see if this will work for you.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Denmark

customer_reviews.title: highly recommended. I works well
customer_reviews.text: I found a Youtube video that teaches you how to fold it up again...highly recommended. I works well, but the amateur has to learn this lesson: the screen has to be lit fairly evenly to get a consistent result. Lighting matters.
customer_reviews.author: Barry D. Raphael

customer_reviews.title: Huge but easy to store
customer_reviews.text: Stores easily. Surprisingly huge! Let’s light shine through from behind though, so you will need to put another sheet behind it if a light source is behind you, like a window.
customer_reviews.author: DAVID A DUNN

customer_reviews.title: The stand is flimsy. The item is wrinkled. ...
customer_reviews.text: The stand is flimsy. The item is wrinkled. No instructions on how to set it up and the seller was unfamiliar with the product.
customer_reviews.author: LT

product_meta.title: Fotodiox 5'x7' Collapsible Chromakey Green + Blue 2-in-1 Background, Backdrop kit w/Stand Support
product_meta.description:
Style:Green/Blue| Size:5x7 Panel + Support StandThe Fotodiox 5x7ft Chromakey green and blue background panel kit is professionally designed to be used by anyone in any scenario. The 2-in-1 design allows you to choose what chromakey color your shoot calls for and makes it easy to setup with the included support stand. Simply pop open the background panel and use the clamp on the support stand to hold your background into place. Whatever your needs are, the colors are quality ensured for an effortless chroma keying process from the shoot to post production. This is perfect for any content creator on the go or for use in a small space. The steel spring frame pops open the backdrop in seconds and helps maintain its shape. When folded down it is a compact 30x30 inch disc that can be stored in its included carrying case.

Note:
Use the green side when replacing the background with a daytime, bright, or outdoor scenes. This helps with the color cast green causes due to it being a bright color. The opposite works with the blue side when your background replacement scene is dark or at night.
To avoid color spill, be sure to allow enough space between your subject and the background. 
Be sure to properly light the backgrounds. The green side will need less lighting than the blue side. 
Never shoot on the green side if your subject is wearing green. The same can be applied to the blue side.
All pictures are for illustration purposes only. Actual product may vary slightly due to ongoing improvements in design.
feature_bullets: Pro-Grade Material, Heavy Duty Construction with floor stand
Chromakey Green and Blud Background Provides Flexible Solution for Location Job

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars677 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
